channel.title: French plane lost in ocean storm
channel.description:
An Air France plane carrying 228 people from Brazil to France has vanished over the Atlantic after flying into turbulence, airline officials say. The Airbus sent an automatic message at 0214 GMT, four hours after leaving Rio de Janeiro, reporting a short circuit. It may have been damaged by lightning. It was well over the ocean when it was lost, making Brazilian and French search planes' task more difficult. France's president said the chances of finding survivors were "very small".
[img]http://newsimg.bbc.co.uk/media/images/45853000/jpg/_45853758_007423654-1.jpg[/img] http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/8076848.stm

item.title: French plane lost in ocean storm
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:23, topic:281760”]IIRC, the plane was lost in a blind spot from the radar.

If the signal from the plane is lost (GPS signal) it can still fly. So if it crashes, you can’t find it.[/quote]
It quite normal that planes disappear from radars when flying over sea, the problem was that they lose the radio contact so it they had little clue where the plane was.

Read full topic

item.title: French plane lost in ocean storm
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

IIRC, the plane was lost in a blind spot from the radar.

If the signal from the plane is lost (GPS signal) it can still fly. So if it crashes, you can’t find it.

item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

My friend was in a helicopter crash. From the time they figured something was wrong, it took 5-6 seconds to hit the ground. They just fell out of the sky. The pilot was able to make the helicopter land on it’s tail to absorb the impact, and they all walked out without a bruise lol.

item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

haticks:

I just heard on the news that Air France had received a bomb threat on that flight 2 days beforehand. So now they’re thinking terrorists did it.

so i herd u liek mudkipz?

Isn’t it weird that you can ‘lose’ a plane, I mean cmon, I lose things in my but, but a plane and nearly 300 people? wtf?

item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

haticks:

I just heard on the news that Air France had received a bomb threat on that flight 2 days beforehand. So now they’re thinking terrorists did it.

That is true however that is just a coincidence. The pilots probably didn’t expect a catastrophic failure of most electric components however they must have not been surprised when it did happen because they quite literary flew into thunderstorm.

Looks like they found parts of the plane, I guess everyone must have died. If they can find the black box I guess they can figure out what happened, that’s really sad.[/quote]
